message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.CC, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with coding theory and information theory, specifically focusing on erasure and list decoding. Therefore, cs.IT (Information Theory) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also involves analyzing the performance of codes with respect to block length, which falls under the purview of cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms). The paper also discusses Slepian-Wolf coding, which is a form of distributed source coding, and hence cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) is another likely sub-category. The paper also involves analyzing the expected rate of codes, which can be seen as a form of computational complexity, and hence cs.CC (Computational Complexity) is another possible sub-category. Finally, the paper involves deriving bounds on the third-order coding rate, which can be seen as a form of statistical learning theory, and hence cs.LG (Machine Learning) is another possible sub-category.
